"If we switched to renewable energy, the number of ships crossing the ocean would fall almost in half. Because they're just carrying #coal and #oil and gas" -Bill McKibben on Bird.

Port of Long Beach exports a good deal of #petroleum coke & coal that are deemed too dirty to burn in the US. #Shipping fuel is itself filthy (dirtier than diesel).

Map is a screenshot of global marine traffic (red vessels are #tankers), via http://marinetraffic.com

EDIT: for my reply guys: https://press.uchicago.edu/ucp/books/book/chicago/O/bo185167017.html

title: The Virtual Production of The Mandalorian Season Two

last_post.content: TIL that ILM has replaced Unreal Engine with an in-house renderer for its Stagecraft virtual sets. Also, I underestimated how fast they'd iterate and create bigger volumes than those for The Mandalorian's first season. It's pretty impressive seeing the whole poop deck from 1899 on a turntable, surrounded by giant screens. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-gX4N5rDYeQ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KrM9FQZpIAE

title: GitHub - tysam-code/hlb-CIFAR10: Train to 94% on CIFAR-10 in less than 10 seconds on a single A100, the current world record. Or ~95.77% in ~188 seconds.

last_post.content:
I like the idea of kaggle but with constraints (parameter count, inference time, training time, data availability, architectural restrictions, etc).

A few months ago I first learned about the DAWNBench challenge [1] through a fantastic series about fast training [2]. Then yesterday, there was a post about reaching 94% accuracy on CIFAR10 in ~10 seconds [3], which got me thinking about it again.

[1]: https://dawn.cs.stanford.edu/benchmark/index.html
[2]: https://myrtle.ai/learn/how-to-train-your-resnet/
[3]: https://github.com/tysam-code/hlb-CIFAR10

Today I got a surprising and disheartening email from Wes of #Oakland & #Berkeley based Pitch Interactive notifying their contacts that they will be shutting their doors after 16+ years.

Pitch is *the* reason I became interested in #dataviz, after seeing their powerful piece on U.S. drone strikes titled, “Out of Sight, Out of Mind”: https://drones.pitchinteractive.com/

If you’re not familiar with Pitch and their work take a minute to check out their website: https://www.pitchinteractive.com/

title: Pitch Interactive: A Data Visualization Studio

title: Andy Ngô keeps reporting people on Twitter who post this very real photo of him standing by far-right graffiti

last_post.content:
In October 2021, after I exposed Andy Ngo's connections to a banned far-right terrorist group responsible for arson attacks in Poland, Ngo filed a false DMCA copyright complaint with Twitter to try to suppress my reporting on this story.

Twitter permanently suspended my account due to Ngo's false report, but reversed their decision after a legal challenge by the EFF. Despite Ngo's violation of Twitter's Terms of Service, he was never sanctioned by Twitter. https://www.dailydot.com/debug/andy-ngo-falanga-picture-dmca-twitter/?amp

title: New AI classifier for indicating AI-written text

last_post.content:
26% true positive?? That is not a lot of percent..

https://openai.com/blog/new-ai-classifier-for-indicating-ai-written-text/

Apparently my uni is testing a system that compared the last year of a student's work for suspicious outliers. This seems much better for both essay mills and genAI. But apparently it's too expensive..🤣

It has become increasingly clear to me that the wide availability of AI-based text generation tools coupled with the "publish-or-perish" incentive of the current scientific publishing system is a dangerous mix, which puts academia on a straight path to becoming a cargo cult. So I wrote an essay about it. Below is a short summary: 1/

https://lookalikes.substack.com/p/publish-or-perish-and-chatgpt-a-dangerous

#scicomm #academia #llm #chatgpt #publishing #science #research #writing

title: Secret hold restricts DOJ's bid to access phone of Trump ally Rep. Scott Perry

last_post.content:
#DOJInvestigation

We have new info about the DOJ investigation into the Jan. 6 attack.

We know that on August 9th, the feds seized Rep. Scott Perry’s phone.

Perry has been in court trying to prevent the DOJ from accessing the information.

A lower court said prosecutors could have access to his data, but now everything is held up on appeal.

https://www.politico.com/news/2023/01/30/secret-hold-doj-phone-trump-scott-perry-00080233

Most of your questions can be answered here: https://terikanefield.com/all-new-doj-investigation-faqs/

1/

Another online public lecture from #ISAWNYU has just dropped: Joan Oller Guzmán, " Emeralds from the Desert: Challenges, Issues, and Successes of Emerald Mining in the Egyptian Eastern Desert in the #Roman and #Byzantine Periods," 3 March 2023, 11:00 AM US Eastern Time. More info and required registration: https://isaw.nyu.edu/events/emeralds-from-the-desert

title: Make Your Mark in the Fediverse with Buffer’s Mastodon Scheduler

last_post.content:
Hello fediverse! Buffer now officially supports Mastodon scheduling. 🥳

The Mastodon community is growing fast, with a set of principles we admire. We’re excited to explore it with you and help you build a consistent and engaging Mastodon presence.

Let’s get tooting!

https://buffer.com/mastodon
